transactionSet.name: Credit/Debit Adjustment
transactionSet.description: This Draft Standard for Trial Use contains the format and establishes the data contents of the Credit/Debit Adjustment Transaction Set (812) for use within the context of an Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) environment. The transaction set can be used to notify a trading partner of an adjustment or billback and may be used to request an adjustment or billback. It identifies and contains the details and amounts covering exceptions, adjustments, credits, or debits for goods or services. This transaction set is multidirectional between trading partners.

segment.name: Transaction Set Header
segment.description: To indicate the start of a transaction set and to assign a control number

dataElement.name: Transaction Set Identifier Code
dataElement.description: Code uniquely identifying a Transaction Set

dataElement.name: Transaction Set Control Number
dataElement.description: Identifying control number that must be unique within the transaction set functional group assigned by the originator for a transaction set

segment.name: Beginning Credit/Debit Adjustment
segment.description: To transmit identifying dates and numbers for the transaction set and indicate the monetary value to the receiver of the transaction

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Credit/Debit Adjustment Number
dataElement.description: Number assigned by issuer of a credit or debit memo

dataElement.name: Transaction Handling Code
dataElement.description: Code designating the action to be taken by all parties

dataElement.name: Amount
dataElement.description: Monetary amount

dataElement.name: Credit/Debit Flag Code
dataElement.description: Code indicating whether amount is a credit or debit

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Invoice Number
dataElement.description: Identifying number assigned by issuer

dataElement.name: Vendor Order Number
dataElement.description: Number assigned by a vendor referencing a particular customer purchase order

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Purchase Order Number
dataElement.description: Identifying number for Purchase Order assigned by the orderer/purchaser

dataElement.name: Transaction Set Purpose Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying purpose of transaction set

dataElement.name: Transaction Type Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the type of transaction

dataElement.name: Reference Identification Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code qualifying the Reference Identification

dataElement.name: Reference Identification
dataElement.description: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

dataElement.name: Action Code
dataElement.description: Code indicating type of action

segment.name: Currency
segment.description: To specify the currency (dollars, pounds, francs, etc.) used in a transaction

dataElement.name: Entity Identifier Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property or an individual

dataElement.name: Currency Code
dataElement.description: Code (Standard ISO) for country in whose currency the charges are specified

dataElement.name: Exchange Rate
dataElement.description: Value to be used as a multiplier conversion factor to convert monetary value from one currency to another

dataElement.name: Entity Identifier Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property or an individual

dataElement.name: Currency Code
dataElement.description: Code (Standard ISO) for country in whose currency the charges are specified

dataElement.name: Currency Market/Exchange Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the market upon which the currency exchange rate is based

dataElement.name: Date/Time Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code specifying type of date or time, or both date and time

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Time
dataElement.description: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

dataElement.name: Date/Time Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code specifying type of date or time, or both date and time

segment.description: To transmit identifying information as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

dataElement.name: Time
dataElement.description: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

dataElement.name: Time Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the time. In accordance with International Standards Organization standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to Universal Time Coordinate (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow

dataElement.description: Code identifying the type of communication number

segment.name: Terms of Sale/Deferred Terms of Sale
segment.description: To specify terms of sale

dataElement.name: Terms Type Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying type of payment terms

dataElement.name: Terms Basis Date Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the beginning of the terms period

dataElement.name: Terms Discount Percent
dataElement.description: Terms discount percentage, expressed as a percent, available to the purchaser if an invoice is paid on or before the Terms Discount Due Date

dataElement.name: Terms Discount Due Date
dataElement.description: Date payment is due if discount is to be earned expressed in format CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Terms Discount Days Due
dataElement.description: Number of days in the terms discount period by which payment is due if terms discount is earned

dataElement.name: Terms Net Due Date
dataElement.description: Date when total invoice amount becomes due expressed in format CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Terms Net Days
dataElement.description: Number of days until total invoice amount is due (discount not applicable)

dataElement.name: Terms Discount Amount
dataElement.description: Total amount of terms discount

dataElement.name: Terms Deferred Due Date
dataElement.description: Date deferred payment or percent of invoice payable is due expressed in format CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Deferred Amount Due
dataElement.description: Deferred amount due for payment

dataElement.name: Percent of Invoice Payable
dataElement.description: Amount of invoice payable expressed in percent

dataElement.name: Description
dataElement.description: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

dataElement.name: Day of Month
dataElement.description: The numeric value of the day of the month between 1 and the maximum day of the month being referenced

dataElement.name: Payment Method Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying type of payment procedures

dataElement.name: Percent
dataElement.description: Percentage expressed as a decimal

segment.name: Date/Time Reference

dataElement.name: Date/Time Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code specifying type of date or time, or both date and time

dataElement.name: Date

dataElement.name: Time Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the time. In accordance with International Standards Organization standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to Universal Time Coordinate (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow

dataElement.description: Code indicating the date format, time format, or date and time format

dataElement.name: Date Time Period
dataElement.description: Expression of a date, a time, or range of dates, times or dates and times

dataElement.name: Description
dataElement.description: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

dataElement.description: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

dataElement.name: Quantity Received

dataElement.name: Unit or Basis for Measurement Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.description: Numeric value of weight

dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Volume
dataElement.description: Value of volumetric measure

dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Order Sizing Factor

dataElement.name: Price Bracket Identifier
dataElement.description: Identifier assigned by the vendor for a specific price bracket

dataElement.name: Transportation Method/Type Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the method or type of transportation for the shipment

dataElement.name: Standard Carrier Alpha Code
dataElement.description: Standard Carrier Alpha Code

dataElement.name: Shipment/Order Status Code
dataElement.description: Code indicating the status of an order or shipment or the disposition of any difference between the quantity ordered and the quantity shipped for a line item or transaction

dataElement.name: Reference Identification
dataElement.description: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

segment.name: Service, Promotion, Allowance, or Charge Information

dataElement.name: Percent
dataElement.description: Percent expressed as a percent

dataElement.name: Rate

dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Quantity

dataElement.name: Option Number
dataElement.description: A unique number identifying available promotion or allowance options when more than one is offered

dataElement.name: Description
dataElement.description: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

dataElement.name: Language Code
dataElement.description: Code designating the language used in text, from a standard code list maintained by the International Standards Organization (ISO 639)

segment.name: Item Physical Details
segment.description: To specify the physical qualities, packaging, weights, and dimensions relating to the item

dataElement.name: Pack
dataElement.description: The number of inner containers, or number of eaches if there are no inner containers, per outer container

dataElement.name: Size
dataElement.description: Size of supplier units in pack

dataElement.name: Unit or Basis for Measurement Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Packaging Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the type of packaging; Part 1: Packaging Form, Part 2: Packaging Material; if the Data Element is used, then Part 1 is always required

dataElement.name: Weight Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code defining the type of weight

dataElement.name: Gross Weight per Pack
dataElement.description: Numeric value of gross weight per pack

dataElement.name: Unit or Basis for Measurement Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Gross Volume per Pack
dataElement.description: Numeric value of gross volume per pack

dataElement.name: Unit or Basis for Measurement Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Length
dataElement.description: Largest horizontal dimension of an object measured when the object is in the upright position

dataElement.name: Width
dataElement.description: Shorter measurement of the two horizontal dimensions measured with the object in the upright position

dataElement.name: Height
dataElement.description: Vertical dimension of an object measured when the object is in the upright position

dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.description: The number of eaches per inner container

dataElement.name: Surface/Layer/Position Code
dataElement.description: Code indicating the product surface, layer or position that is being described

dataElement.name: Assigned Identification
dataElement.description: Alphanumeric characters assigned for differentiation within a transaction set

dataElement.name: Assigned Identification
dataElement.description: Alphanumeric characters assigned for differentiation within a transaction set

dataElement.name: Number
dataElement.description: A generic number

segment.name: Service, Promotion, Allowance, or Charge Information
segment.description: To request or identify a service, promotion, allowance, or charge; to specify the amount or percentage for the service, promotion, allowance, or charge

dataElement.name: Allowance or Charge Indicator
dataElement.description: Code which indicates an allowance or charge for the service specified

dataElement.name: Service, Promotion, Allowance, or Charge Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the service, promotion, allowance, or charge

dataElement.name: Agency Qualifier Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the agency assigning the code values

dataElement.name: Agency Service, Promotion, Allowance, or Charge Code
dataElement.description: Agency maintained code identifying the service, promotion, allowance, or charge

dataElement.name: Amount
dataElement.description: Monetary amount

dataElement.name: Allowance/Charge Percent Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code indicating on what basis allowance or charge percent is calculated

dataElement.name: Percent
dataElement.description: Percent expressed as a percent

dataElement.name: Rate
dataElement.description: Rate expressed in the standard monetary denomination for the currency specified

dataElement.name: Unit or Basis for Measurement Code
dataElement.description: Code specifying the units in which a value is being expressed, or manner in which a measurement has been taken

dataElement.name: Quantity
dataElement.description: Numeric value of quantity

dataElement.name: Quantity
dataElement.description: Numeric value of quantity

dataElement.name: Allowance or Charge Method of Handling Code
dataElement.description: Code indicating method of handling for an allowance or charge

dataElement.name: Reference Identification
dataElement.description: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

dataElement.name: Option Number
dataElement.description: A unique number identifying available promotion or allowance options when more than one is offered

dataElement.name: Description
dataElement.description: A free-form description to clarify the related data elements and their content

dataElement.name: Language Code
dataElement.description: Code designating the language used in text, from a standard code list maintained by the International Standards Organization (ISO 639)

segment.name: Reference Identification
segment.description: To transmit identifying information as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

dataElement.name: Reference Identification Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code qualifying the Reference Identification

dataElement.name: Reference Identification
dataElement.description: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

dataElement.name: Free-form Description
dataElement.description: Free-form descriptive text

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Time
dataElement.description: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

dataElement.name: Time Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the time. In accordance with International Standards Organization standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to Universal Time Coordinate (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow

dataElement.name: Reference Identification Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code qualifying the Reference Identification

dataElement.name: Reference Identification
dataElement.description: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

dataElement.description: Code qualifying the Reference Identification

dataElement.name: Reference Identification
dataElement.description: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

segment.name: Date/Time Reference
segment.description: To specify pertinent dates and times

dataElement.name: Date/Time Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code specifying type of date or time, or both date and time

dataElement.name: Date
dataElement.description: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD

dataElement.name: Time
dataElement.description: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

dataElement.name: Time Code
dataElement.description: Code identifying the time. In accordance with International Standards Organization standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to Universal Time Coordinate (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow

dataElement.name: Date Time Period Format Qualifier
dataElement.description: Code indicating the date format, time format, or date and time format

dataElement.name: Date Time Period
dataElement.description: Expression of a date, a time, or range of dates, times or dates and times

segment.name: Transaction Set Trailer
segment.description: To indicate the end of the transaction set and provide the count of the transmitted segments (including the beginning (ST) and ending (SE) segments)

dataElement.description: Total number of segments included in a transaction set including ST and SE segments
